content.title: SEAk Platform Tutorial
content.description: A no-code GeoAI-powered platform to streamline marine debris damage assessment post-disaster.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: SEAk enables rapid AI-based analysis of aerial imagery, grid-based insights, cost estimation, and interactive visualization tools for informed decision-making.

sections.title: Platform Overview – Section Guide
sections.content: Quick guide to SEAk sections and their purpose.

features.name: Login / Sign Up
features.description: Access your account using email and OTP. New users can register with their email ID.

features.name: Projects
features.description: View all created projects. Each project can have multiple workspaces.

features.name: Workspaces
features.description: Displays all workspaces within a project. Includes AOIs, datasets, models, and tools.

features.name: Recent
features.description: Lists recently accessed workspaces for quick reopening.

features.name: Drafts
features.description: Shows incomplete workspaces, which can be resumed later.

features.name: AOIs (Areas of Interest)
features.description: View and manage saved AOIs. Edit or reuse them across workspaces.

features.name: Datasets
features.description: Lists all uploaded raster and vector datasets. Add new datasets for analysis.

features.name: Create Workspace
features.description: Guided setup for creating a workspace by selecting project, AOI, datasets, and tools.

features.name: Map Dashboard
features.description: Main interface for running analytics, applying AI models, and visualizing results.

features.name: SEAk Analysis Dashboard
features.description: Charts, graphs, and attribute tables for deeper analysis and insights.

subsections.title: Login and Project Section
subsections.content: Projects act as containers for analyses, datasets, and workspaces. After logging in, you arrive at the Project Section where you can select an existing project or create a new one.
steps: Navigate to the Projects section and click 'Add New Project'.
Enter Project Name and Description.
Add Tags by typing and pressing Enter.
Click 'New Project' to save or 'Cancel' to discard.
Click on the project card to access or manage its workspaces.

subsections.title: Workspaces
subsections.content: Workspaces are subdivisions within a project, each focused on a specific Area of Interest (AOI) or type of analysis.
steps: Click 'Create Workspace' within the project.
Step 1: Enter Workspace Name, Description, and Domain.
Step 2: Define AOI by selecting an existing AOI, uploading a KML/SHP/GeoJSON, or manually drawing.
Step 3: Select Assessments applicable to your project.
Step 4: Choose pre-trained models and save the workspace.

sections.title: Map Dashboard
sections.content: The interactive interface zoomed to the AOI, where analytics are run and visualizations displayed.
components: Run AI Model – Apply AI models on datasets for predictive vector layers.
Assessments – Generate indices using raster datasets.
Compare Map – Compare two layers side-by-side with basemap options.
Annotate – Create labeled layers with AI-assisted editing.
Proximity Analysis – Measure distances, run spatial queries, and calculate statistics.
Change Detection – Compare pre- and post-disaster images.
SEAk Aware Analysis – Plan clean-up activities based on configurations.
Pull Vector – Add additional vector data.
Comments – Add or reply to geotagged comments.
Download Report – Export dashboard as PDF.
SEAk Aware Configuration – Configure layers and settings for SEAk Aware analysis.
Profile Icon – Manage profile and dashboard theme.
Layer View – Manage and view available layers.

sections.title: Running Analytics
sections.content: Use the Analytics Tool to apply AI models or specialized analyses on datasets.
steps: Select dataset (Pre-event or Post-event).
Choose model.
Click 'Run'.

sections.title: Visualizing Results
sections.content: Outputs appear as layers. Use Layer View under Models to activate them.

subsections.title: Styling Layers
subsections.content: Adjust Stroke (boundary) and Fill (polygon interior) using the color picker and opacity slider. Submit to apply changes.

subsections.title: Grid View
subsections.content: Divide the AOI into grids for granular insights. Adjust grid size with +/- buttons and click cells to view analytics.

sections.title: Cost Analysis
sections.content: Estimate costs based on zoning and measurements.
steps: Open layer menu and select 'Cost'.
Select cost configuration and currency.
Assign zoning layers (commercial/residential).
Choose measurement units (sq ft, linear ft, cubic ft).
Enter cost values.
Save and run model. Results appear in infographics.

sections.title: Hotspot Analysis
sections.content: Identify high-concentration debris or changes with adjustable blur limit and radius.

sections.title: Change Detection Analysis
sections.content: Compare pre- and post-disaster imagery to detect changes.
steps: Go to Analytics Panel → Change Detection.
Select pre- and post-disaster layers.
Name the result and run analysis.

subsections.title: Configuration
subsections.content: Set filters, toggle visibility, add notes, define habitats, and upload data.

subsections.title: Running Analysis
subsections.content: Select prediction layer, name the result, and run the analysis.
outputs: Proximity Analysis – debris near infrastructure or habitats

sections.title: Collaboration Tools
sections.content: Right-click the map to add comments. Access all via More Options → Comments. Reply to geolocated comments for team collaboration.

sections.title: Exporting Results
sections.content: Go to More Options → Download Report to export the dashboard as a PDF file.
